Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome.  I may be biased as I am coming from a regular tube TV, but I have friends and family with HDTVs that I can compare with.  The picture quality on HD channels is excellent and on regular channels is pretty good too.  Sound quality is good enough for me, my wife thinks its only OK.  Set up is easy as can be, I set it up without needing the manual.  I needed the directions in setting up the Netcast features but this was relatively easy too.The only bad thing I can say has nothing to do with the TV, it has to do with shipping.  The product took twice as long to get to me as was quoted.  I realize that this was bought after Thanksgiving and shipping slows a bit at this time but when your quoted a week and then a week goes by and it hasn't even shipped yet, that's poor business.  In the end I received the TV and now I am quite happy.

Reviews.Title: A great buy
Reviews.Author: S. Hohneisen "Movie Maker Wannabe"
Reviews.Content: We have had this tv up and running for about a week now.  The picture is gorgeous!  We haven't used the internet applications yet but hope to do so shortly.  We are very pleased with our purchase!

Reviews.Title: Very satisified
Reviews.Author: matthew madden
Reviews.Content: I looked at a bunch of LED TVs but finally settled on this model and I am very happy with it. The picture quality is very good and I'm sure would be even better if I took the time to properly calibrate it. The design of the TV is also very nice. Extremely thin and relatively light weight for the size. My favorite feature however is the Netflix app. It was so easy to setup! Just plug in the ethernet cable and the TV does the rest. For the money, I really think this is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: VC "VC"
Reviews.Content: We are loving it and are quite happy with the choice we made. The wifi enabled internet apps makes the experience so much more richer. I would have given a 5 except for the sound quality - which is not great though esp. on streaming. I hear a jarring noise if I increase the volume beyond 10.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: J. Riggleman
Reviews.Content: Wonderful TV...a big improvement for us.  Excellent packing and delivery.  Feels like the people are going to jump off the screen and join you in the living room.  No problems with set up.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!  Even Better Service!!
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I got everything I wanted with the TV.  It was shipped very securley with bubble wrap completely surrounding the tv.  I received is days before I expected, which was awesome.  Highly reccommend doing business with these guys.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv shame about Internet Apps Not working with Bekin N+ Router
Reviews.Author: sne0000
Reviews.Content: Great Tv, shame about internet apps and wireless integrationPros -- Picture Quality- loved the auto-adjust sensor for day and night viewing..- Ability to play video from my external HDD (including music, video & photos from my digital camera were allCons -- Unable to get working with additional USB adapter and Belkin n+ router, (After a lot of playing around, finally contacted LG Support how indicated Wireless USB does not work with Belkin N+ router at this time, and I sould either buy a new router or plug it in to the router directly (enough said)...- No PIP functionality (would have liked to split screen my computer with tv)

Reviews.Title: Great picture, poor sound, frustrating data input using remote
Reviews.Author: Rajiv S. Kumar "Rajiv"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this after much research. The picture quality is amazing as many reviewers here have pointed out. But the audio quality is terrible (also noted by most reviewers). It sounds like the hosts on CNN are talking to you on a telephone (sometimes worse). I thought using HDMI inputs you should get the best of everything. It seems the audio quality is an issue with most Flat Screen TVs nowadays because the manufacturers expect you to have external speakers. If you like to watch VH1 or like to listen to MP3s on your external USB, then the audio quality is going to be an issue.For internet access, I am using a wireless USB dongle from LG. I have a one word review for this feature - "FRUSTRATING." It asks you for a wireless WPA password everytime you turn on the TV instead of remembering it. Since the remote doesn't have a QWERTY keyboard, you have to use telephone like inputs to enter your inputs. The inbuilt browser is pretty bad. It doesn't try to fill in forms for you from previous inputs. Page navigation (forwards, backwards) doesn't work the way computer browsers do. So I often have to input entries all over again when I am trying to search Youtube videos, using the telephone like keypad. Perhaps TVs will have better inbuilt browsers in a couple of years.I am still giving this 4 stars because of the picture quality on some of the HD shows. But note that a lot of video content, especially old archives are not shot in HD, so when the TV tries to stretch it to fit the big screen, it can look pretty bad.

Reviews.Title: More than I expected
Reviews.Author: C. Mok
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a large screen monitor for a project I am working on that requires a fair bit of screen real estate. I was tired of toggling between tabs and moving windows around my iMac monitor.  Buying an 30" Apple Monitor screen would have set me back $1799. I started to do some research and I was surprised to find price of comparable LED screens to be significantly less.I bought this at a local retailer as an open box item for $950. The additional features of Internet and WiFi ready, D-TV scanning and audio options just makes this a no brainer even at full retail price.Took a little while to get this all set up but well worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Kapampangan ku
Reviews.Content: My first one was a Sharp 40 LED aqous which I returned to Best buy becausee it is so bad that I prefer to watch on my CRT TV.Then after reading a lot of reviews and going to the store (Best Buy) I finally decided on this LG 42" LED5400 model. I've had to say that it is way better than the Sharp TV and cheaper too. I got mine last Dec. 2010 for $900 with a free 14" lcd tv from Best Buy. What I like most about it is it's Netflix interface which is better than the Netflix interface in my Sony BRP (which is wireless by the way so I don't need the LG wifi adapter)So from now on, when I buy TV, LG is my first option

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV, Awesome Value
Reviews.Author: Dan from DC
Reviews.Content: I bought this last year around the holiday season when it was only $799.  What an AMAZING TV.  The picture is crystal clear, the speakers are crisp and loud (if you want them to be - some TVs dont have a loud volume) and the color is spot on!This is my first HDTV and I'm loving every minute of it.  Now when I order PPV MMA fights, I get to see all the action in HD.  I went to my parents to watch TV and standard definition looks so blurry now compared to HD.Look for coupons/sales like I did and get a good deal on this TV if you can - otherwise, even at $1300 I believe it's worth the money.

Reviews.Title: mess1
Reviews.Author: mess1
Reviews.Content: The sound and picture quality is superb.  Love watching HD pictures, as the characters seem that they are in the room with you.

Reviews.Title: LG le5400 42" edgelit LED internet app ready 120hz TV
Reviews.Author: CTmets Fan "shoes54"
Reviews.Content: First of all i`m very satisfied with my purchase of this LG le5400 42" edgelit led TV.My other choice was the the Samsung 40" 6000 seriesI choose the LGThis review could cover all three versions of this set: 5300le basic 42" led tv 5400le internet app 42" led tv (wireless is a add on option 115.00) 5500le wireless internet built in app 42" led tv  The delivery was "white glove" which i did not expect, they unpacked the Tv set it up and tested itoffered the option to take the box (garbarge away)  Is this the best 42" Tv ........NO! but its very good for the money  On a scale of 1-100 i would give it a 86......so yes there is room for improvementThe "final" setup allow 45-60 minutes for tweaking settings in the menu color, tint, brightness sound backlight level,and firmware updates. There are a ton of tweaks you can do to this set ON the down side it take 15 seconds for Netflix app to load  there IS some backlight bleed in spots ONLY when in 16:9 mode and if you look really hard for itspeakers that come with it  ARE ok but add on one`s really add to the viewing experienceGenerally speaking it has a very rich picture 90/100 scoreI have had this set for 4 months as of today 4-21-11 and i would reccomend this to friends

Reviews.Title: Great TV in LED LCD HD class
Reviews.Author: technoswitch
Reviews.Content: Set up is 5 min, has easy Picture Wizard to get optimum picture for a show. You can Zoom to get full screan if Blue Ray disk gives you black bars, requires HDMI to get best features, do not use AV cables they are included as a prop they do not use full HD capabilities; base is heavy enough to avoid tipping but if ih you have children you must secure screen to a wall or furniture bolts and clamps are provided in a box with TV

Reviews.Title: remote
Reviews.Author: jack
Reviews.Content: tv seems to work just fine so far. has very good picture. only problem is the remote sucks. the netcast and widgets button is to close to the direction arrows. when im searching netflix movies it is too easy to hit the netcast button and then it starts all over. maybe i will get used to it but i dont know. a real pain in the a--. overall i think it was a good purchase

Reviews.Title: Edge Lit LED technology problems
Reviews.Author: Mo
Reviews.Content: Great feature rich thin LED TV however due to the edge lit technology you will be very disappointed with flashlight looking light sources in all corners in dark scenes.  You will not notice this till you take it home and watch it in complete darkness.  Included remote is not universal and design sucks.  I bought it from Bestbuy and returned it.  I would stay away from this one.  Vizio XVT series is looking better and better.

Reviews.Title: Terrible backlight bleed and Noticeable lag
Reviews.Author: happygolucky
Reviews.Content: To be fair, I'm not a big tv/movie watcher.  I don't even have cable (or any free channels for that matter).  We were looking for a new tv to replace one that I broke a few months ago.  Its only purpose would be to watch free online content via a computer, occasional movie watching, and playing video games. The lag on this tv while playing video games was enough to make us return it.  It also has major backlight bleed.  It was immediately noticeable, especially around the corner and edges and in also the center.  After researching, it looks like LG has used 2 different panels for this tv.  Unfortunately, we got a bad one.From what we watched, the picture quality was fine.  You definitely need to turn off the true motion to stream netflix or else the contrast is noticeably off but I've seen this on the Samsung as well.  As for it's other features: Aesthetically - the tv looks great.  The remote and menus were user-friendly.  Seeing that I still need to connect my computer to the tv, I found most of the app pretty useless.

Reviews.Title: What a letdown!
Reviews.Author: bethany
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV from a large electronics store for $900. It had excellent specs for the price. We got it home, set it up, and immediately noticed that the whole left side of the screen was brighter than the rest of the TV. It was noticeable even while watching a movie. With a black screen, the "flashlight" light bleeding was painfully obvious - there were distinct blotches scattered around the screen, with the left side being the most uneven. It was really too bad, because this TV was truly beautiful and the picture quality was excellent. Even the speakers sounded good. But the blotchiness was unacceptable so we packed it back up and returned it.I do not know if this is a weakness of all edge lit LED LCD TVs, but rather than gamble on another I think I will just buy a second plasma model.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Awesome Product!!!
Reviews.Author: sampler
Reviews.Content: An excellent product. Easy to operate, setup, connect etc. Awesome picture quality with LED back lighting. Awesome product, like it very much.

Reviews.Title: Amazon current price
Reviews.Author: Leonid Zolotarev "leo"
Reviews.Content: Please check the price on HSN right now.  It is $899.00, and the item is on a flex pay plan: 5 payments of 179.99.

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Laurence P. Letarte "Pats fan"
Reviews.Content: Shortly after setting up the TV the control panel and remote were non-functioning.There was no volume control etc. and I would have to unplug the set in order to turn it off.When plugged back in, at times it would reset and the controls and remote would temporarily work normally.On other occasions when plugged back in, the TV would turn on immediately with the control panel and remote were not functioning.There appeared to be no correlation with the time left unplugged and whether it worked normally or not.

Reviews.Title: pending
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: As of today still waiting for a replacement for original TV.  After hook up found sound OK, but no picture.  Changed cables even had local cable company come in.  Customer very anxious to have the new TV in place.................
